title.narrative: Preparatory Phase for the Global Network of Regional Sustainable Energy Centers Platform

description.narrative:
Within the following preparatory project, UNIDO aims to make the Global Network of Regional Sustainable Energy Centres (GN-SEC) Platform fully operational and sustainable. The preparatory works will include the development of a strategic external evaluation, a feasibility assessment and a project document on the first operational phase of the Platform. It will also facilitate initial joint south-south and triangular knowledge and technical cooperation activities.
The preparatory project is based on the technical support provided by UNIDO for the establishment and operation of various regional sustainable energy centres in Africa, Caribbean, Pacific, Himalaya-Hindukush and Central America between 2010 and 2018 under one common programmatic framework. The first centre was established in partnership with the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) in Praia, Cape Verde, in 2010.
In partnership with Member States and other sub-regional players (e.g. power pools, utility organisations, regulatory authorities, regional banks), the GN-SEC centres work towards the creation of integrated and inclusive regional markets for sustainable energy and climate technology (SECT) products and services. Through cross-border approaches and methodologies, the centres complement and accelerate national efforts in the areas of policy and regulation, capacity development, knowledge and data management, awareness raising, as well as the promotion of investment, innovation and entrepreneurship.
Since some of the centres have reached a certain level of maturity and share similar challenges and opportunities, it was agreed to create a formalised global GN-SEC platform to facilitate joint learning, programming and project implementation. Together the centres are a strong advocate for SDG-7, SDG-9 and SDG-13 and joint interests in international policy processes. The Platform provides a “maker-space” for south-south and triangular partnerships and projects, as well as knowledge/technology transfer within the GN-SEC and internationally.
The preparatory project is also based on the outcomes of several GN-SEC Steering Committee meetings and the High Level Conference on “Regional Cooperation to Accelerate Sustainable Energy Innovation and Entrepreneurship in Developing Countries”. The conference was co-organised by UNIDO and the Austrian EU-Presidency on 3rd October 2018 in Vienna. The conference summary and a comprehensive technical report include concrete recommendations for the further development of the GN-SEC Platform.
A detailed project document on the preparatory phase is attached. Further information is available at: www.se4allnetwork.org.
